text: East Lynn is an unincorporated community in Butler Township, Vermilion County, Illinois. ==History== The town, founded in 1872, is said to have been named after the novel and play entitled East Lynne. The Methodist church was actually founded before the town, in 1869. The main trade was in grain. One man, Henry Ludden, filled several early roles in the town, as the first postmaster, the first station agent, and the first to operate a store. ==Geography== East Lynn is located at . ==References== ==External links== *NACo East Lynn welcome sign Category:Unincorporated communities in Vermilion County, Illinois Category:Unincorporated communities in Illinois Category:Populated places established in 1872 Category:1872 establishments in Illinois
title: East Lynn, Illinois
